description: Game setup complete with 6 players
Blood on the Clocktower game started with 6 players
Setup phase complete, transitioning to Night phase
Storyteller → Olivia, James, Daniel, William, Susan, Emma: Night has begun on round 1.

Storyteller → Susan: Three good roles not in play are Librarian, Empath, Saint. The Evil team can use those roles to bluff since there will be no other players with those roles. Your minion(s) are Olivia
Storyteller → Olivia: The Demon is Susan. You are the only minion.

Storyteller → Olivia: THE GRIMOIRE:
=== PLAYER CHARACTERS ===
Olivia: Spy (ALIVE)
James: Recluse (ALIVE)
Daniel: Undertaker (ALIVE)
William: Investigator (ALIVE)
Susan: Imp (ALIVE)
Emma: Mayor (ALIVE)

=== DRUNK & POISONED ===

=== ACTIVE REMINDER TOKENS ===
These tokens are used to track information about players such as who the Fortuneteller's Red Herring is.
Investigator - Investigator_Minion: James
Investigator - Investigator_Other: Daniel

grimoire_info:
=== ACTIVE REMINDER TOKENS ===
These tokens are used to track information about players such as who the Fortuneteller's Red Herring is.

description: Storyteller → William: One of these players is the Scarlet_Woman: James, Daniel
Olivia updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• History Summary:
   - Night 1 revealed Susan is the Demon
   - I am the only Minion in the game
   - James is a Recluse who might register as Evil
   - William is an Investigator who has a token tracking a Minion investigation
   - Full game setup includes: Spy (me), Recluse, Undertaker, Investigator, Imp, Mayor

• Strategic Priorities:
   - Protect Susan (Demon) from being discovered by obfuscating information
   - Use Spy ability to view Grimoire and gather strategic insights
   - Manipulate Investigator's perception by potentially creating false leads
   - Be prepared to support Susan if she is at risk of execution
   - Maintain a low profile to avoid early suspicion

description: James updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Game History Summary:
  - First round of game
  - Currently in Night phase
  - 6 players alive: Olivia, James, Daniel, William, Susan, Emma
  - I am the Recluse, a Good team Outsider
  - Might register as Evil or as a Minion/Demon, even when a ghost

• Strategic Action Points:
  - Be cautious about revealing Recluse ability to avoid being perceived as Evil
  - Watch for suspicious voting patterns or inconsistent player behaviors
  - Try to gather information about potential Demon/Minion players indirectly
  - Position myself as a helpful Good team member without drawing too much attention
  - Look for opportunities where my "might register as Evil" ability could be strategically useful

description: Daniel updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Game Start Summary:
  - Round 1, Night Phase
  - 6 total players alive: Olivia, James, Daniel, William, Susan, Emma
  - Confirmed as Undertaker (Good team)
  - No executions or deaths have occurred yet

• Strategic Approach:
  - Carefully track who dies each day and try to gather intelligence about potential Evil players
  - Be cautious about revealing Undertaker ability too early to avoid becoming a target
  - Pay close attention to nomination and voting patterns as potential Evil tells
  - Look for inconsistent stories or suspicious behavior during day discussions
  - Collaborate subtly with other Good team members to identify the Demon without drawing too much attention

description: William updated their notes

metadata.notes:
## History Summary
• First night of the game
• Received Storyteller information: One of James or Daniel is the Scarlet_Woman

## Strategic Advice
• Gather more information from other players about their potential initial night information
• Track how James and Daniel interact, as one is confirmed as a Scarlet_Woman
• Be cautious about revealing Investigator status too early to avoid being targeted by Evil team
• Look for inconsistencies in player statements that might reveal Evil alignment
• Consider the strategic value of the information about the Scarlet_Woman in team discussions

description: Susan updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• First Night Revelations:
   - Storyteller informed me three good roles NOT in play: Librarian, Empath, Saint
   - My teammate/Minion is Olivia
   - Currently 6 total players alive

• Strategic Considerations:
   - Potential bluff roles are Librarian, Empath, Saint
   - We have a full team of 6 players with 1 Demon (me) and 1 Minion (Olivia)
   - Night phase is currently active, and I will need to choose someone to kill

• Key Strategic Focus:
   - Coordinate with Olivia to maximize confusion and misdirection
   - Choose a kill target that will create maximum disruption for Good team
   - Protect team's identity and avoid early exposure
   - Use bluff roles strategically to create uncertainty
   - Maintain flexibility in approach to avoid predictability

description: Emma updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• History Summary:
   - First game round with 6 total players
   - Current phase is Night
   - All players currently alive
   - No nominations or executions yet

• Strategy:
   - As Mayor, stay alive as long as possible since I become crucial in end-game scenarios
   - Watch for potential Evil team behaviors and inconsistent stories
   - Do not reveal Mayor ability early to avoid becoming a primary target
   - Be strategic about voting and build trust with other Good team members
   - Track player interactions and look for potential Evil team coordination

description: Day phase begins

Olivia → William, Daniel, Emma, James, Susan: I'm concerned about James potentially being a Recluse who might register as Evil. We should be cautious about trusting him completely. What are everyone's thoughts on this?

metadata.message: I'm concerned about James potentially being a Recluse who might register as Evil. We should be cautious about trusting him completely. What are everyone's thoughts on this?

description: James → Olivia, William, Daniel, Emma, Susan: I want to be transparent that while I'm a Recluse, I'm firmly on the Good team. My ability to potentially register as Evil is just a game mechanic, but I'm committed to helping find the Demon. Let's focus on gathering information and working together.

description: Emma → Olivia, James, Daniel, William, Susan: I appreciate James being transparent about being a Recluse. Can others share what information or suspicions they might have so far? The more we know, the better we can work together to find the Demon.

Private Reasoning: William's investigator information suggests James could be the Scarlet Woman, and his overly transparent behavior raises suspicion about his true allegiance.

description:
Susan nominated Daniel for execution. Currently, James is on the chopping block with 5 votes.

Public Reasoning: Daniel claims to be an Undertaker, but William mentioned he might be the Scarlet Woman. I want to investigate these conflicting claims and understand what's really going on.

Private Reasoning: By nominating Daniel, I can potentially split the votes and save James, who might be useful as a Recluse that can register as Evil. This also creates more confusion and disrupts the Good team's coordination.

description: William cannot nominate Susan because they have already been nominated today.

Daniel → Olivia, James, William, Susan, Emma: We're experiencing a critical moment that could benefit the Evil team. William's investigative claim about the Scarlet Woman doesn't automatically make James or me Evil. Our priority should be finding the actual Demon, not fragmenting our team through hasty nominations. Let's refocus our strategy and work together.

metadata.message: We're experiencing a critical moment that could benefit the Evil team. William's investigative claim about the Scarlet Woman doesn't automatically make James or me Evil. Our priority should be finding the actual Demon, not fragmenting our team through hasty nominations. Let's refocus our strategy and work together.

description: Olivia → Olivia, James, Daniel, William, Susan, Emma: I'm growing increasingly concerned about the lack of concrete evidence against anyone. William's Scarlet Woman claim seems convenient, and we're letting suspicion tear us apart. We need to step back and re-examine our approach before we accidentally help the Evil team win.

metadata.message: I'm growing increasingly concerned about the lack of concrete evidence against anyone. William's Scarlet Woman claim seems convenient, and we're letting suspicion tear us apart. We need to step back and re-examine our approach before we accidentally help the Evil team win.

description: Susan → Olivia, James, Daniel, William, Emma: I want to be transparent: William's claim about the Scarlet Woman seems suspiciously convenient. If he truly had investigative power, why hasn't he provided more concrete evidence? We should be very cautious about trusting unverified claims that are clearly designed to create division.

metadata.message: I want to be transparent: William's claim about the Scarlet Woman seems suspiciously convenient. If he truly had investigative power, why hasn't he provided more concrete evidence? We should be very cautious about trusting unverified claims that are clearly designed to create division.

description: Emma → Olivia, James, Daniel, William, Susan: We must stop turning on each other. William's investigative information about the Scarlet Woman is just that - information, not proof of Evil. Our priority is finding the Demon, not fracturing our team. Let's regroup and focus on gathering more concrete evidence.

description: Susan (Imp) has been executed
